idp_entity_id.description: The unique identifier for your SaaS application.

name_id_format.description: The format of the name identifier sent to the SaaS application.

public_key.description: The Access public certificate that will be used to verify your identity.

sp_entity_id.description: A globally unique name for an identity or service provider.

sso_endpoint.description: The endpoint where your SaaS application will send login requests.

allowed_idps.description: The identity providers your users can select when connecting to this application. Defaults to all IdPs configured in your account.

items.description: The identity providers selected for application.

app_launcher_visible.description: Displays the application in the App Launcher.

auto_redirect_to_identity.description: When set to `true`, users skip the identity provider selection step during login. You must specify only one identity provider in allowed_idps.

allow_credentials.description: When set to `true`, includes credentials (cookies, authorization headers, or TLS client certificates) with requests.

max_age.description: The maximum number of seconds the results of a preflight request can be cached.

custom_deny_message.description: The custom error message shown to a user when they are denied access to the application.

custom_deny_url.description: The custom URL a user is redirected to when they are denied access to the application.

domain.description: The domain and path that Access will secure.

enable_binding_cookie.description: Enables the binding cookie, which increases security against compromised authorization tokens and CSRF attacks.

http_only_cookie_attribute.description: Enables the HttpOnly cookie attribute, which increases security against XSS attacks.

logo_url.description: The image URL for the logo shown in the App Launcher dashboard.

same_site_cookie_attribute.description: Sets the SameSite cookie setting, which provides increased security against CSRF attacks.

service_auth_401_redirect.description: Returns a 401 status code when the request is blocked by a Service Auth policy.

session_duration.description: The amount of time that tokens issued for this application will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or µs), ms, s, m, h.
